page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: This block is not totally devoid of woodland, but has few large stands. The woods are mainly deciduous hard- woods, planted either as fox coverts after late eighteenth century Enclosure, or as shelter belts around isolated farms. These woods contain oak, ash, beech and sycamore. There are a few elm trees left, but most of these have been killed off by Dutch Elm Disease during the last decade. There are a number of alder trees along the becks. There are also isolated, mature trees in the hedge- rows. Such hedges as remain are mainly hawthorn, but there are some ancient hedgerows, e.g. at{Collow,}which contain hawthorn, blackthorn, field- maple, oak, guelder rose, elder and sweet-briar.
